briefdescription.para: Writes the CPUID information into the provided context for a specific leaf.

detaileddescription.para: This function retrieves the CPUID information for a given leaf and stores the results in the last_cpuid_result field of the provided basic_ctx context.

parameterdescription.para: The BASIC context where the CPUID result is stored.

briefdescription.para: Writes the CPUID information into the provided context for a specific leaf and subleaf.

detaileddescription.para: This function retrieves the CPUID information for a given leaf and subleaf and stores the results in the last_cpuid_result field of the provided basic_ctx context.

parameterdescription.para: The BASIC context where the CPUID result is stored.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves a specific CPUID register value from the context.

detaileddescription.para: This function retrieves the value of a specific CPUID register (eax, ebx, ecx, edx) from the last_cpuid_result in the provided basic_ctx.

parameterdescription.para: The BASIC context where the CPUID result is stored.
The register to retrieve (0 = eax, 1 = ebx, 2 = ecx, 3 = edx).

simplesect.para: The value of the specified CPUID register.

briefdescription.para: Executes a legacy CPUID instruction for a specific leaf and subleaf.

detaileddescription.para: This function executes the CPUID instruction with a specified leaf and subleaf and stores the result in the context's last_cpuid_result.

parameterdescription.para: The BASIC context where the CPUID result is stored.

simplesect.para: 1 if the subleaf is not -1, 0 if it is.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the last CPUID register value from the context.

detaileddescription.para: This function retrieves the most recent CPUID register value stored in the last_cpuid_result from the provided basic_ctx.

parameterdescription.para: The BASIC context where the CPUID result is stored.

simplesect.para: The value of the last CPUID register queried.

detaileddescription.para: This function retrieves the CPU brand string by executing CPUID with leaf values 0x80000002, 0x80000003, and 0x80000004 and concatenating the result.

ctx
The BASIC context.
The CPU brand string.
Retrieves the CPU brand string.
This function returns the brand of the CPU, providing information about the specific CPU model that the system is running.

simplesect.para: The brand of the CPU

detaileddescription.para: This function retrieves the CPU vendor string by executing CPUID with leaf value 0 and storing the result in the last_cpuid_result.

ctx
The BASIC context.
The CPU vendor string.
Retrieves the CPU vendor string.
This function returns the vendor of the CPU, providing information about the manufacturer of the CPU.

simplesect.para: The vendor of the CPU

briefdescription.para: Converts an integer value to a string representation.

detaileddescription.para: This function converts the specified integer value into its ASCII representation as a string, with a specified length.

ctx
The BASIC context.
The string representation of the integer value.
Converts an integer value to a string representation.
This function converts a number into its ASCII equivalent. For example, the number 123 would be converted to the string "123".

simplesect.para: The ASCII string representation of the number

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the CPUID result for a specific leaf and subleaf.

detaileddescription.para: This function executes CPUID for a specified leaf and subleaf and returns the value of a specific CPUID register as defined by the reg parameter.

simplesect.para: The CPUID result of the specified register.

detaileddescription.para: BASIC syntax: OUTPORTport,value
Writes an 8-bit value to the specified I/O port.

ctx
Interpreter context (supplies arguments and error reporting).
The value is truncated to 8 bits before being written.
Raises a runtime error if the number or type of arguments is invalid.
Writes an 8-bit value to an I/O port.
BASIC syntax: OUTPORTport,value

parameterdescription.para: Interpreter context (provides parameters and error reporting).

simplesect.para: The value is truncated to 8 bits before the write.
Raises a runtime error if the argument count or types are invalid.

detaileddescription.para: BASIC syntax: OUTPORTWport,value
Writes a 16-bit value to the specified I/O port.

ctx
Interpreter context.
The value is truncated to 16 bits before being written.
Raises a runtime error if the number or type of arguments is invalid.
Writes a 16-bit value to an I/O port.
BASIC syntax: OUTPORTWport,value

simplesect.para: The value is truncated to 16 bits before the write.
Raises a runtime error if the argument count or types are invalid.

detaileddescription.para: BASIC syntax: OUTPORTDport,value
Writes a 32-bit value to the specified I/O port.

ctx
Interpreter context.
The value is truncated to 32 bits before being written.
Raises a runtime error if the number or type of arguments is invalid.
Writes a 32-bit value to an I/O port.
BASIC syntax: OUTPORTDport,value

simplesect.para: The value is truncated to 32 bits before the write.
Raises a runtime error if the argument count or types are invalid.

detaileddescription.para: Reads an 8-bit value from an I/O port.
BASIC syntax: v=INPORT(port)

simplesect.para: 8-bit value (0255) widened to int64_t.
Raises a runtime error if the argument count or types are invalid.

detaileddescription.para: Reads a 16-bit value from an I/O port.
BASIC syntax: v=INPORTW(port)

simplesect.para: 16-bit value (065535) widened to int64_t.
Raises a runtime error if the argument count or types are invalid.

detaileddescription.para: Reads a 32-bit value from an I/O port.
BASIC syntax: v=INPORTD(port)

simplesect.para: 32-bit value widened to int64_t.
Raises a runtime error if the argument count or types are invalid.

detaileddescription.para: BASIC syntax: r=BITOR(a,b)

simplesect.para: (a | b) as int64_t.

detaileddescription.para: BASIC syntax: r=BITAND(a,b)

simplesect.para: (a & b) as int64_t.

detaileddescription.para: BASIC syntax: r=BITNOT(a)

simplesect.para: (~a) as int64_t.
Twos-complement semantics on 64-bit integers.

briefdescription.para: Implements BITEOR(a, b) bitwise XOR (BBC EOR).

detaileddescription.para: BASIC syntax: r=BITEOR(a,b)

simplesect.para: (a ^ b) as int64_t.

detaileddescription.para: BASIC syntax: r=BITNAND(a,b)

simplesect.para: ~(a & b) as int64_t.

detaileddescription.para: BASIC syntax: r=BITNOR(a,b)

simplesect.para: ~(a | b) as int64_t.

detaileddescription.para: BASIC syntax: r=BITXNOR(a,b)

simplesect.para: ~(a ^ b) as int64_t.

briefdescription.para: Implements BITSHL(a, n) logical left shift.

detaileddescription.para: BASIC syntax: r=BITSHL(a,n)

simplesect.para: a << n, computed in 64-bit.
Implementations typically clamp n to 063.

briefdescription.para: Implements BITSHR(a, n) logical right shift.

detaileddescription.para: BASIC syntax: r=BITSHR(a,n)

simplesect.para: Logical shift right of a by n (uses unsigned semantics), widened to int64_t.
Implementations typically clamp n to 063.

briefdescription.para: Implements BITROL(a, n, width) rotate left within width bits.

detaileddescription.para: BASIC syntax: r=BITROL(a,n,width)

simplesect.para: a rotated left by n within the lowest width bits.
Width is usually 164; the result is masked to width bits.

briefdescription.para: Implements BITROR(a, n, width) rotate right within width bits.

detaileddescription.para: BASIC syntax: r=BITROR(a,n,width)

simplesect.para: a rotated right by n within the lowest width bits.
Width is usually 164; the result is masked to width bits.
